Title: Twilight
Author: স্টেফেনি ম্যায়ের
Summary:
'Twilight' Summary of the book
Twilight is the first book in a multi-volume series aimed at young adult readers that has inspired such loyalty and excitement among its readers that some are comparing it to the Harry Potter phenomenon. Like J. K. Rowling's series, Twilight focuses on a young person who really does not have a functioning family.  Like Harry, Bella Swan learns that there is more to the world than she thought. But where Harry Potter encountered the reality of magic, young Bella must face the fact that vampires are real. And, while Harry quickly falls in love with magic and the world of magic he explores, Bella falls in love in a far more literal sense: she falls for Edward Cullen, one of the beautiful, ethical vampires living in her new home of Forks, Washington.

This leads her into intense danger, first from Edward, who must master his intense desire to drink her blood if she is to live, and then from other vampires who are not as ethical or civilized as Edward and his loving adoptive family. The result is a striking blend: one part young adult novel about high school romance, two parts intense and often erotic desire between a young girl and a hundred-year-old vampire, and a final portion a rollercoaster of a thriller as another vampire tries to kill Bella. Written in clear prose and with a markedly ethical tone, Twilight has appealed to so many readers that it made it onto the New York Times bestseller list. Twilight was made into a movie starring Kristen Stewart as Bella in December 2008.

Title: New Moon
Author: স্টেফেনি ম্যায়ের
Summary:
Summary of the Book

New Moon picks up from where Twilight ended. Bella is seen enjoying her eighteenth birthday in the company of Edward and his vampire family. Bella accidently gets a paper cut while unwrapping a gift, which turns things violent as the scent of her blood overwhelms Edward’s brother Jasper, who then attempts to kill her. In order to protect Bella, Edward leaves town with the rest of his family. His sudden departure leaves Bella heartbroken. In a constant state of depression, she turns to her friend Jacob Black for comfort and solace. Meanwhile, Jacob is also hiding an enormous secret of his own, which if Bella happens to discover, would make things even more complicated.

Edward is just as miserable as Bella and is longing to come back to her. But he fears it might get a little too late and he will be left broken-hearted all over again. Eventually, Bella and Edward’s relationship takes a dark turn which is represented by the celestial darkness during a new moon. Will Bella and Edward be able to forget the past and start all over again? New Moon has been translated into 38 languages and has sold millions of copies all around the world. A film adaptation of New Moon was released on November 20, 2009.

About Stephenie Meyer

Stephenie Meyer is an American producer and children’s author who is known for the Twilight series, which is a young-adult vampire-romance saga. She has written four novels as part of the Twilight series – Breaking Dawn, New Moon, Eclipse, and Twilight. She has written The Twilight Saga: The Official Illustrated Guide and The Short Second Life Of Bree Tanner as supplements to the Twilight series. She has also written a sci-fi novel called The Host, and a collection of stories named Prom Nights From Hell.

Meyer was born Stephenie Morgan on December 24, 1973, in Hartford, Connecticut. She was raised along with her five siblings in Phoenix, Arizona. She studied at the Chaparral High School in Scottsdale, Arizona. In 1997, she graduated with a BA in literature from the Brigham Young University in Provo, Utah. In 2008, Stephenie was named Author Of The Year by USA Today. She also earned the second spot on Amazon’s list of bestselling authors of the decade. She is married to Christian Meyer. The couple has three sons - Eli, Seth, and Gabe. She currently lives in Cave Creek, Arizona, with her family.

Title: Eclipse
Author: স্টেফেনি ম্যায়ের
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Eclipse continues the story of Isabella Swan and her vampire love, Edward Cullen. The book explores Bella's compromise between her love for Edward and her friendship with werewolf Jacob Black. The story begins with Seattle getting ravaged by string of mysterious murders, which according to Edward is caused by a group of newborn vampire controlled by Victoria. Bella once again finds herself in the midst danger and she is forced to choose between her love for Edward and her friendship with Jacob. She well aware that her decision has the potential to ignite the never ending  conflict between vampire and werewolf. With their graduation approaching, Bella has one of the most important decisions of her life. Who will Bella choose and will she be able to survive Victoria’s wrath?
